means: 哭泣，啜泣( sob的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: I was curled up on the floor in a corner sobbing hysterically.
sentence.Network_cn: 我蜷缩在地上的某个角落，失声痛哭。

sentence.Network_en: Julia blows her nose, but her sobbing goes on uncontrolled.
sentence.Network_cn: 朱莉娅擤了擤鼻子，不过她还是不停地啜泣。

sentence.Network_en: The room was silent except for her sobbing.
sentence.Network_cn: 房间里静悄悄的，只有她的啜泣声。

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...soavissimo〔意〕极其柔和，甜美，温和的。sobbing〔英〕抽泣的，呜咽的。sobre〔西〕在…之上，在上面。
...soavissimo〔意〕极其柔和，甜美，温和的。sobbing〔英〕抽泣的，呜咽的。sobre〔西〕在…之上，在上面。
poor little Dora was sobbing and screaming with fear , and a moment was lying unconscious on the sofa .可怜的小朵拉恐怖地抽泣，尖叫着，不一会儿倒在沙发上，失去了知觉。
La Toya ran in the hospital sobbing after Jackson was pronounced dead ., 香格里拉爷跑在医院嚎啕大哭后 , 杰克逊被宣布死亡.

哈佛学生教你学英语_甜梦文库... ... on-the-job training 在职培训；岗位培训 sob story 伤感故事 aftersales service 售后服务.

entry.def: When someone sobs, they cry in a noisy way, breathing in short breaths.

example.ex: She began to sob again, burying her face in the pillow...
example.tran: 她把脸埋在枕头里，又开始抽噎起来。

example.ex: Her sister broke down, sobbing into her handkerchief.
example.tran: 她姐姐再也控制不住自己的情绪，捂着手绢呜咽起来。

entry.def: If you sob something, you say it while you are crying.

example.tran: 她呜咽着说：“一切都是我的错。”

entry.def: A sob is one of the noises that you make when you are crying.
